# The `GloballyHashedType` Struct Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A globally hashed type represents a hash value that is sufficient to uniquely identify a record across multiple type streams or type sequences. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

A globally hashed type represents a hash value that is sufficient to uniquely identify a record across multiple type streams or type sequences.

This works by, for any given record A which references B, replacing the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/codeview/typeindex">TypeIndex</a> that refers to B with a previously-computed global hash for B. As this is a recursive algorithm (e.g. the global hash of B also depends on the global hashes of the types that B refers to), a global hash can uniquely identify that A occurs in another stream that has a completely different graph structure. Although the hash itself is slower to compute, probing is much faster with a globally hashed type, because the hash itself is considered &quot;as good as&quot; the original type. Since type records can be quite large, this makes the equality comparison of the hash much faster than equality comparison of a full record.

Definition at line 80 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/codeview/typehashing-h">TypeHashing.h</a>.

### hashType() {#acc7b052c15351bf328b64c17027eae9d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>GloballyHashedType GloballyHashedType::hashType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; RecordData, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/codeview/globallyhashedtype">GloballyHashedType</a> &gt; PreviousTypes, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/codeview/globallyhashedtype">GloballyHashedType</a> &gt; PreviousIds)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Given a sequence of bytes representing a record, compute a global hash for this record.

Due to the nature of global hashes incorporating the hashes of referenced records, this function requires a list of types and ids that RecordData might reference, indexable by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/codeview/typeindex">TypeIndex</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/codeview/typehashing-h/#l00106">106</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/codeview/typehashing-h">TypeHashing.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/codeview/typehashing-cpp/#l00033">33</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/codeview/typehashing-cpp">TypeHashing.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
